column5: well 4th day of my summer vacation and had the need to do some fishing..but I sold my nitro  so the folding boat to the rescue I decided to go to a kawartha lake with the little boat..  hooked up the 5 hp honda and off I went  well almost,   the gas wasn't getting to the motor..turns out the hose inside the tank broke...luck would have it I had the 2.5 in the back of the truck so all was well and off I go..   right off I see a bunch of dead carp.......that means it has worked it's way through the whole kawarthas and simcoe is the next stop.....     I get down to fishing and get into some perch     then into the bass    the walleye were good to me too        and of course every time I have fished the kawarthas this year I get muskie not big but great colours and markings on it I didn't take a picture of it but I did have my digi camera hanging from my neck with on video while I was fighting it it isn't very good but the sun reflecting on the lake looks like a lazer show..check it out  and my set up        <object width="425" height="350"><param name="movie" value="
Too bad about the carp but thanks the cool video Terry, that folding boat really seems to be serving you well.
Hey thats a cool way to shoot a video on yur own eh! Nice release I was fully expecting it to soak you and the camera. Nice work. Enjoy the rest of yur holidays.
nice mixed bag you caught there looks like fun
Cool little set up you got there Terry...not a bad day at all I'd say.  Maureen
Interesting...have never seen a folding boat before.  Loved the song.  My son watched it with me and he was wondering if the fish was dead...nope...he enjoyed watching it swim away.
HEy..............how did ya????.......oh never mind. Nice fish Terry.
my home lake is clear lake.  have got 6 walleye in six  daysthis year 5 keepers.  i want to catch some muskie does anyone know any good spots around there.   thanks

The reason your musky had such nice markings on it was because it was a tiger musky. There must be some pike in that lake as well. As much as I love to see them, tiger muskies mean the end is near for musky in that lake and the pike will soon take over. By soon I mean a decade or so depending on the size of the lake. I hope your kawartha lake is on the Simcoe side of Balsam. Nice pics and that was a cool video.
Hey Terry, that has to be a Tiger Muskie for sure. We will have to make a trip out there together again, maybe Cook's Bay too. My boat has spent too much time in the driveway this year.
Thats not a place for a shiny new prop to be skud. LOL    Terry,where the heck am I to sit when we go to u know where?LOL  Cool vid.
Nice variety of fish, that's a good day fishing. Cool video as well!  Great report,  ehg

thanks all for just having the camera hanging from my neck it's not a bad video  Mis... I would take less toys so there would be room for you Skud,  I would like that  I have just put in a offer on a 16ft walkthrough windshield SYLVAN with a 90 on it...so maybe I will have a boat before my 3 weeks vacation is done...LOL
great report!  loved the video!  cheers!
Very nice vid, Terry.  Thanks for your post.
Great report, pics, and vid Bubba!!!... now go back to work slackard!
